page.title: 09 GREAT EAST STANDEN MANOR
page.content: Great East Standen manor dates back from 1086 when it was held by William Fitzstur. In the Domesday book it is called Standone. In 1503 Princess Cicely, a daughter of Edward IV came to live at the manor on her marriage to Richard Keynes, an islander. In 1603 the Earl of Southampton, Captain of the Island, lived here. He constructed a bowling green on nearby St.Georges Down. Regular meetings were held for local gentry including the Oglanders from Nunwell and the Worsleys from Appuldurcombe, all famous Isle of Wight families. The present manor house was built in 1737, It has had alterations over the years. Its secluded position made it ideal for involvement in smuggling in the 18th centry. The present owner enjoys a quiet country manor only 3km from the centre of Newport.
